column4: I installed ntfs-config and now I don't seem to be able to unmount windows drives. Any advice?
remove the ntfs-config then try to unmount
will the drives still mount without it?
yea
thanks
as long u have usbmount
I'll check
usbmount is currently not installed
I have a External Drive thats NTFS and I didn't need the ntfs-config
the reason i installed ntfs-config was because of some HAL-storage error
what type of drive internal or external
both
hmm
I don't no about HAL-storage errors
like i say, ntfs-config worked its magic and the drives were instantly mounted and writable - I just want to be able to mount them manually with write access when i need them
but ntfs drives usually automount
I think the package you need is automount
!find automount
the error message when trying to unmount is cannot open /media/.hal-mtab
|!find automount
nothing
hmm well I never have had the error
hmm well I look around the forums u may find something there
thanks - I have just removed the drives from fstab and will see if manually starting them works now
